results.title: Come see the dolphins
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Media and Tom Ascher
results.brief_description: Presents the story of a young boy who accompanies his father, a dolphin keeper, to the zoo to see the dolphins. The boy learns of the appearance of dolphins, what they eat and how they communicate and navigate. Skillful photography includes observations underwater and behind the scenes views of equipment and workers needed to maintain the dolphin pool.

results.title: Come out fighting
results.brief_description: A young Aboriginal boxer is taken up by University students and finds it hard to adjust entering their bourgeois white world. This short is ragged and rough around the edges but it offers a rivetting glimpse into black and white relations in the early seventies, as well as some wonderful realistic sequences set in inner-city boxing gyms.

results.title: Come out fighting
results.brief_description: Low budget realistic work made with assistance from the Experimental Film and Television Fund. Adapted from a play by Harry Martin, it presents a crisis in the life of an Aboriginal boxer in the face of conflicting demands from Aboriginal friends, fight promoters and students campaigning for Aboriginal rights. Cast includes Michael Karpaney, Cliff Neale, Bethany Lee, Peter Green, Bob Horsfall, Peter Adams, Brian Torrens.

results.title: Come into my parlour, said the spider to the fly
results.creator_credit: Densey Clyne, Jim Frazier and Mantis Wildlife Films
results.brief_description: Deals with the predatory techniques of the Australian spiders that feed on insects. Includes spiders that build lidded burrows, spin webs, stack their prey, cast nets, or lure moths into a whirling line.

results.title: Combined ops
results.creator_credit: John Elliot, Philip Dorte and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “War in the Air”.
Using archival footage this episode discusses the air situation in the West during the period early 1942 to spring 1943.

results.title: Combination attacks
results.creator_credit: Don Kelly and Gerard Holdsworth Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Judo”.
In judo, combination attacks are very important in the application of tactics, and in their turn tactics play a part in competition. Combination attacks have more objectives than simple terminal throwing. One other obvious objective is to tire the opponent. If attach after attack is launched and every time the opponent has to avoid and by doing so moves into another attack, it can becomes very exhausting - both physically and mentally. Here are demonstrated ouchi-gari into uchi-mata, ouchi-gari into tai-otoshi, ouchi-mata into sutemi-waza and ne-waza combination.

results.title: Combating the '79 locust plague
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
In 1979, the biggest locust plague in 25 years threatened pasture and crops valued at hundreds of millions of dollars in New South Wales, Victoria and South Australia. Army and Air Force units helped farmers, graziers, State, Federal and rural authorities to fight the menace.

results.title: Combat fatigue: insomnia
results.brief_description: Describes one of the milder effects of combat fatigue in its portrayal of one sailor’s inability to sleep. Solution is offered through some simple relaxation techniques. Stars Dick York (famed for “Bewitched” TV series, etc).

results.title: Columns and Gables
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Architecture at the Crossroads Series”.
Part Two of a series which examines the main themes in world architecture today. The series looks at the work of architects who are at the centre of the current debate, and introduces some younger architects who are beginning to make a name for themselves. Part Two looks at the most influential buildings and architects of the 1980s, loosely grouped under the new architectural expressions such as “post-modern”, “high-tech”, and “rationalism”.
